author: CandleSmartHome.com
description: Turn a Pi into a security camera or smart doorbell
name: Candle cam

Portrait mode.description: Enable this is you would like the camera to record in portrait mode instead of landscape.

High resolution.description: If this controller has a camera, then this determines at what level of visual detail the stream is sent. Normally the camera streams at 640x480 pixels to enable streaming to multiple devices at once. If you enable high resolution mode the stream will be 720p (1280x720 pixels), but at the cost of only live streaming to one device at a time.

Rotate Camera.description: If a camera is attached to this controller, then you can rotate its camera image. The default rotation is 0 degrees.

Motion snapshot threshold.description: Above which motion level should a snapshot automatically be taken? Set to 100 to disable automatically taking snapshots when motion is detected. The default is 50%.

Camera cover delay.description: If you're using Candle Camera as a polite doorbell, how long should the camera cover stay open after the doorbell is pressed? The default is 1 minute.

Data retention days.description: For how many days should snapshots be stored? The default is 2 days. Set to 0 to disable taking snapshots.

Disable sending snapshots to Matrix mess.description: If you are also using the Voco addon and have created a Matrix messenger account with it, then you can receive snapshots from the camera on your mobile devices. If you are using Candle Camera as a smart doorbell, then you could receive a photo whenever someone presses the doorbell. Normally you can switch this on and off at any time, but you can fully disable the feature if you prefer.

Send snapshots to printer.description: If enabled, and if a (Bluetooth) printer is connected, then newly saved snapshots will also be sent to the printer. Please discuss enabling this feature with people who frequent your home.

Debugging.description: Enable this to see much more detail in the internal log about what this add-on is doing. Useful during development or figuring out why something is not working.
